channel.title: Comments on: Knockout.JS: Dictionary/Index and ObservableArray, Part 2

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description: I've never used the mapping plugin, so I can't say.
item.content:encoded: I’ve never used the mapping plugin, so I can’t say.

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
The key doesn't "need" to be unwrapped technically. It works as is shown. Only if you're passing in something that's possibly an observable do you need to unwrap it.
It's a good suggestion if you're doing something a bit more complex.
I was not. :)
item.content:encoded:
The key doesn’t “need” to be unwrapped technically. It works as is shown. Only if you’re passing in something that’s possibly an observable do you need to unwrap it.

It’s a good suggestion if you’re doing something a bit more complex.

I was not. :)

item.title: By: DotNetWise
item.dc:creator: DotNetWise
item.description: Oh nice, it actually works! Just a small tweak: the key needs to be unwrapped as below if (keyName) { // if there is a key keys[ko.utils.unwrapObservable(v[keyName])] = v; // use it }
item.content:encoded:
Oh nice, it actually works!
Just a small tweak: the key needs to be unwrapped as below
if (keyName) { // if there is a key
keys[ko.utils.unwrapObservable(v[keyName])] = v; // use it
}

item.title: By: DotNetWise
item.dc:creator: DotNetWise
item.content:encoded:
Intersting!
How do you use it along with the mapping plugin?
Without it, is pretty useless, if your model is complicated.

Would be nice to be a parameter of the mapping object
i.e. ko.mapping.fromJS(data, {
withIndex: {
key: true,
time: true
}
});
